comments.body:
```suggestion
    findSite(key: string, salt?: string | number): string;
```

(the salt is technically anything that has a .toString() method)

https://github.com/SocketCluster/skeleton-rendezvous/blob/master/index.js#L122

This one is not too obvious to me.

I didn't include it because they don't use the second argument anywhere in the tests.

And in the implementation there is incrementing the `salt` by one:
https://github.com/SocketCluster/skeleton-rendezvous/blob/master/index.js#L150
But then there is also concatenating the `salt` with strings:
https://github.com/SocketCluster/skeleton-rendezvous/blob/master/index.js#L153
My reading of the JS code is `findSite(key:string, salt?: number)`, but I'm not familiar with the library or how it's used in practice.

I've been using this library for quite some time, but I too have no idea of what the `salt` arg stands for. My hypothesis is that it is some internal thing maybe, since this method calls itself recursively with this arg.

So I think we can omit it for now, and maybe add it later if there's demand.

Worth adding the `hash(key: string): string;` method?

https://github.com/SocketCluster/skeleton-rendezvous/blob/master/index.js#L26
